p.s: In the play Disgraced, Scene 3 by Ayad Akhtar Amir Kapoor (Abdullah) is the protagonist.
Amir is a lawyer, about 40 years old and lives in an appartementapartment in New York together with his wife Emily.
In Scene 3 Amir is presented as a really emotional and rude person.
In the beginning of the scene he's full of anger and also a bit desperate because of Jory and not getting promoted in his job.
His language and way of expressing himself is always rude and not nice (p. 71).
He often uses the word fucking in his sentences (p. 71, 72) which shows that he's not really kind and nice towards other people.
Because of not getting promoted in his job that Jory gets, he acts really emotional and yells most of the time.
He furthermore explodes and can't believe that Emily got promoted even though Amir is twice as long as Emily in the company.

He nearly gets physical when Isaac and him get in a heated conversation which ends up Amir spitting in Isaac's face which shows his disgusting behaviour and racist side about jews probably because of experiences as a little kid when his mom spits in his face because he had a jewishJewish girlfriend which let him spit in his girlfriend's face just because she was jewishJewish.
Amir acts really emotional and doesn't think before doing something which really affects his interactions in the play like when he hit Emily (p. 74).
After realizing what he has done he instantly regrets it and is in shock because of himself which shows he acts totoo fast before thinking of the consequences of his acting.
All in all, Amir is the perfect example of how hard it is to live undercover and what a massive impact Islamophobia and hiding his real identity can have especially after 9/11 as a Muslim.
